data.title: Save hotkey should save according to context
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot Editor

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
*Expected* : when hitting ctrl+s, something is saved according to the current view: if in script view the script is saved, if in scene view the scene is saved
*Happened*: Editor saves the open scene instead of the script

data.title: Failed building a windows desktop template on linux
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux
Ubuntu 17.04
Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4702HQ

Using the default mingw-w64 package in the repos. 

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I tried to build a windows template from source with:
`scons platform=windows tools=no target=release bits=64
`

It fails on the last compiling scene/3d/audio_stream_player_3d.cpp
`scons: Reading SConscript files ...
Checking for C header file mntent.h... (cached) no
scons: done reading SConscript files.
scons: Building targets ...
[100%] Compiling ==> scene/3d/audio_stream_player_3d.cpp
scene/3d/audio_stream_player_3d.cpp: In member function 'void AudioStreamPlayer3D::_notification(int)': scene/3d/audio_stream_player_3d.cpp:195:6: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 void AudioStreamPlayer3D::_notification(int p_what) {
      ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <http://gcc.gnu.org/bugs.html> for instructions.
scons: *** [scene/3d/audio_stream_player_3d.windows.opt.64.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
`


**Steps to reproduce:**
Everytime I build it does.

<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Godot hangs after returning from hibernate.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7, Windows 10
Godot 2.1.4 stable win64

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Upon returning from hibernate godot is unresponsive and never recovers.
This occurs in all areas, e.g. Project Manager and when in a new or existing project

The console window that opens appears responsive however no text is written to it whilst the main godot window is hanging whilst viewing the Project Manager list

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open Godot
2. Hibernate (shutdown /h)
3. Resume from hibernate

data.title: More generic approach for node smart searching
data.body:
Following #11706, I think this might deserve a more generic approach.

Like instead of testing if it is either 2d or 3d, we could use a "genealogic" distance function.
Something like: the number of parent to reach the closest common ancestor of both the root node type and another one.

This distance would be then used to sort the nodes results

data.title: Linux 32bit client and export behaves strangely
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux Mint KDE 32 and 64bit; Godot version 2.1.4 Stable

**Issue description:**
Running the Linux 32bit client gets strange results from physics bodies. For example if you apply the transform() function, the gravity no longer effects the body. As well as generally less accurate collisions.



**Steps to reproduce:**
Download the Linux 32bit Godot client onto a system running Linux Mint KDE 64 or 32bit OS. Setup a test project with a static body and rigid body, apply a script to the rigid body that calls its transform() function (no variables need to be passed in), and you should see the results.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

Cheers!

data.title: Undo-Redo will crash on a missing object.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Activated GL 3.3 contextOpenGL ES 3.0 Renderer: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti/PCIe/SSE2 git @ 36298186f

**Issue description:**
When `UndoRedo::_process_operation_list()` encounters a corrupt objects, it will crash the editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Randomly doing undo and resizing array inspector will likely to reproduce this issue.
Stacktrace pasted below.


None

data.title: Godot3: high level networking. set_network_slave() missing?
data.body:
Not sure if this qualify as bug, but it seems like I am unable to find any reference about.


In the previous unofficial builds here: http://fixnum.org/godot/ there were Godot version with high level network functionality which was removed (latest build working is the "January 2, 2017 at 16:07" one).
Those functionalities are now under development in Godot 3, and few things are chanced (and probably it will be).
In the unofficial builds to set a node master or slave you'll had to use
node.set_network_mode(NETWORK_MODE_MASTER) or node.set_network_mode(NETWORK_MODE_SLAVE). Now it seems to me that this function is being replaced by the command **set_network_master( int id, bool recursive=true )**
But I wasn't able to find a counter-part to set a node as slave (ie: something like set_network_slave); now I was wondering: it is missing or there's new paradigm on how slave nodes are set?

data.title: Allow exporting third-party iOS Frameworks
data.body:
- EditorExportPlugin API now allows adding iOS Frameworks to export.

 - EditorExportPlugin can now distinguish between debug and release
   export.

 - Adds method to DirAccess for recursive copying of a directory.

 - Fixes iOS export to work with Xcode 9 (released recently).

Example usage:

```gdscript
tool
extends EditorPlugin

class SomeFrameworkExportPlugin:
  extends EditorExportPlugin

  func _export_begin(features, debug):
    if debug:
      add_ios_framework("res://SomeDebugFramework.framework")
    add_ios_framework("res://SomeFramework.framework")
    add_ios_plist_content("<key>someKey</key><string>somevalue</string>")

func _init():
  add_export_plugin(FabricExportPlugin.new())
```

data.title: Add OS::is_userfs_persistent, allow starting HTML5 platform in private mode
data.body:
In the HTML5 platform, persistence for `user://` may not be available. Possible reasons include:

 - Using a private/incognito window
 - Disabling cookies
 - Disabling only third-party cookies and running the game in an `<iframe>`

Currently these cases will cause start-up to fail, so the game never starts. For many games persistence is irrelevant, so this is undesirable.

This PR adds `OS.is_userfs_persistent()` as an API for game developers to check if the `user://` file system is persistent. This way, developers can decide for themselves how to handle this situation.
By itself, Godot now just prints an error to the console during start-up if persistence is unavailable.

data.title: Fix possible crash at exit on iOS
data.body: Fixes the crash described at #11623 which happens when the iOS app tries to quit and the render callback keeps getting called (because AudioDriverIphone::finish wasn't clearing the property).

data.title: [GDnative] add library path to init options
3D Freelook with AZERTY keyboard
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Any OS, godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
Keys binded to the 3D freelook are wrong with [AZERTY keyboard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AZERTY ).

Solution : 
* auto-detect the keyboard type (or use current user language) to sets propers key for logic freelook 
* Allow the user in Editor settings to changes keys for freelook
* Bind freelook to LEFT UP RIGHT DOWN keys

data.title: Unfocus active control after exterior click
data.body:
This is especially important and visible for input box - when you
click outside of it, you expect the focus to be gone. On mobile devices
this also makes the virtual keyboard disappear when tapping outside of
a focused element.

data.title: Improve input handling on Android
data.body:
- Dispatch input immediately as it comes, instead of delaying it to the
   next step().

 - Fix text box input handling when caret is at the middle of the text.

 - Minimize queueEvent calls on Java side.

data.title: Feature request: 2D Mask node
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
3.0

**Issue description:**
A 2D node with the same masking behavior as the Scroll Container. The main reason for this is to be able to anchor it at its center making animation a lot easier. Also having a mask that's more simple to use than the Light2D method. 

What it should be able to do:
Masking out anything of its children that extend beyond its borders.
Having its own size setting making animation more flexible.

What would be really cool that it could do:
That any applied masking texture would behave as a Patch9Frame stretching with the size setting making soft edges and other effects possible.


**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Add timeseek_node_get_seek in AnimationTreePlayer.
data.body:
Currently we can only set the seek in an animation node by using timeseek_node_seek but we do not have any way to get the position of the animation.

Other animation nodes have set get methods but this one does not.

It seems reasonable to rename the method timeseek_node_seek to timeseek_node_set_seek and create a new method timeseek_node_get_seek.
